Description: Body fragment of Attic black-figured pottery open vase, probably a column-krater; glazed black inside. Ouside, feline striding to left; preserved are part of its neck, its upper left foreleg, upper hind legs, body, and tip of tail; part of an incised rosette above; added white or red at the ribs, haunch and neck. Exterior glaze is thin and streaky.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 76, no. 254 pl. 57)
Alexandridou 2011 / The Early Black-Figured Pottery of Attika in Context (c. 630-570BCE) (p. 123) (Naukratis 108)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0943)
